Description: Both the Azure Local Integration Architecture and the Cloud Service Provider Threat Model identify unauthorized access as a critical threat.
Both models emphasize the importance of role-based access control (RBAC) to mitigate risks associated with privilege escalation.
Both models face risks from insider threats, highlighting the need for comprehensive monitoring and access controls.
Both models must adhere to similar compliance frameworks, including GDPR and HIPAA, which emphasize data protection and privacy.
Both models are susceptible to denial of service attacks, necessitating robust network defenses.

Source: A frequent threat across various models, indicating a systemic vulnerability in access control mechanisms.
Commonly identified across different models, highlighting the need for robust monitoring and access controls.
A prevalent threat in both cloud and on-premises environments, emphasizing the need for network resilience.
